comment.author: 39469748@N04
comment._content: This was taken during the 1865 flooding of the Genesee River.  The Erie Canal is in the foreground and follows the line of debris to the buildings on the opposite shore.  The aqueduct crossed the River as a stone trough on stone masonry arches.  The flood waters and flotsam are as high as the walls of the aqueduct's trough.

comment.author: 39469748@N04
comment._content: This is the image labeled #61 on the reverse, where the tic mark is (a common way of identifying the image on the front)
